etymologies: late Middle English: from Old French revenu(e) ‘returned’, past participle (used as a noun) of revenir, from Latin revenire ‘return’, from re- ‘back’ + venire ‘come’

definitions: income, especially when of a company or organization and of a substantial nature

examples.text: traders have lost $10,000 in revenue since the traffic scheme was implemented

definitions: a state's annual income from which public expenses are met

examples.text: his priority was to raise government revenue and to lower expenditure

shortDefinitions: state's annual income from which public expenses are met

definitions: items or amounts constituting a state's income
shortDefinitions: items or amounts constituting such income

examples.text: when the revenue makes a demand for tax, that demand is implicitly backed by the powers of the state

shortDefinitions: department of civil service collecting state revenue
